article.headline: Cleveland St. 60, Louisiana-Lafayette 55
article.story: LAFAYETTE, La. -- Cole Norris scored 19 points, including 10 of his team's final 15, and Cleveland State held off Louisiana-Lafayette 60-55 on Friday night. The Vikings are off to a 5-0 start for the first time in school history. The team was 4-0 both in 1963 and 1985. Norris, who came into the game averaging 22.3 points per game, was 8 of 9 from the free-throw line including 6 for 6 in the final 29 seconds. Aaron Pogue added 13 points and Trevon Harmon had 10 for the Vikings. Cleveland State outrebounded Louisiana-Lafayette 39-35, but held a 13-4 edge in second-chance points. The Vikings also scored 16 points off 16 turnovers by the Ragin' Cajuns. La'Ryan Gary scored 19 points and Randell Daigle added 10 for the Ragin' Cajuns (1-3), who have lost two in a row.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
